head.title: Journal of a Passage in a Canoe from Pais Plat in Lake Superior to Portage de l'Isle in River Ouinipique, 1784. - Page #25

body.p: << First Page | < Previous Page | Page #25 of 32 | Next Page > | Last Page >>

td.p: Umfreville, Edward. Journal of a Passage in a Canoe from Pais Plat in Lake Superior to Portage de l'Isle in River Ouinipique, 1784. An electronic transcription. MFTP #0030

div.p: de l'Isle, than the one we were in which goes directly to Port. des Rats, on arriving there, we must descend down Winnepeg river a considerable dist. to Port. de L'Isle where as the one he pointed out is much shorter, this intelligence he inadvertently let fall, as Inds are in the way to Port. des Rats, he was in hopes of raising a drink[.] Luckily our Trusty Guide was Acquainted with ye way, & tho' his wife refus'd to go with us he left her & 2 children to continue in our Co[.] From I. des Framboises WbS2m. to a rod rock on a pt on Rt lac Spacious on Rt & Islands on both sides, then SWbW1m. to a Strait on Lt, but which turns into a River[,] went in it abt 200yds, & then turn'd 1st turning on Rt & went ½m. to S.C. a short dist. from which a long Rapid which was nam'd by Mons St Germaine de le Pouvent, & on wch we were nearly trapp'd for attempting to shoot it we were not aware of a sudden descent it has nearly across ye River over a smooth black rock which is cover'd with water & is difficult to be seen, we had just time enough to gain the Shore, after which all debark'd except 2 to shoot ye Canoe (NB this Rapid may be avoided by passing on the other side of the Id on Lt but there you have a Portage)[.] From the Rapid went down a strong Currt near ½ m. to an Id which we pass'd on our Lt – then ¾ to ye bottom of an Id a short distce from which a lesser one, pass'd it on Rt & went WNW1½ to a pt on Lt leaving an Id on Rt – then between 2 rocks Islds to a low pt of black rocks on Lt 2m. this pt which arange of Islds seems to divide the River in 2 Chans – went along Rt hand shore 1½ to a pt on Rt having small Is & white rocks on Lt – then 2½ to a pt of white rocks streight from last Co – then 2¾ to a small Rapid, where the Chanl is narrow'd by large white Stones projecting from the Lt shore, from the Rapid went 2m. to Port. des Chênes (nam'd by our men) 260yds over on Rt side & after cutting away some wind[,] falls &c. a good road – near the bottom of the Rapid are 2 Is left them on the Rt & in abt 1m. from the Rapid anr Isld left it & a bay on Lt – from the I. went ½m. to a low rocky pt on Rt – then Travers'd to the opposite shore & discharg'd on a rock at the head of a Cataract, Port. was call'd by St Germaine des Tremble 247yds over & (being clear'd) a good road. Exactly opposite is Port. de petite Rivière (named by our men) 500yds over a good road. From this we were introduc'd to a Swamp, in which went ¾ & fell into the Riv. again (the Junction is a fine Fishing place for Sturgeon &c.) from the end of la Petite Rivière, went 8m. to ye mo of a Small River on Rt call'd la Riv. de beau Soleil, its left shore has a stony pt wch our men call'd Pointe au Baptême, on Acct of my Paying my Baptême here[.]

July 23 Friday. From the little Riv. mention'd yesterday went 6m. when our River opens wide in the form of a long lac, then in it 9m. farther, when it has a rounder form, with many Is in it, cross'd it from the pt of an Id on Lt WSW abt 4 having sevl Is on both sides, then turn'd an Isld on Rt in a Strait & went NW1m. havg 2 small rocky Iss on Lt – then came to a Rapid call'd de l'Isle (a small rock[y] I. being on Rt) shot it with ease having plenty of water, from the Rapid NWbW

in lavender , modifications made by the assumed author(s).
